isis.stitle: TSI 92-08-12 - Programming Information for Medium and Heavy Duty Truck Instrument Clusters

subjectgroup.subject: Programming Information for Medium and Heavy Duty Truck Instrument Clusters

geninfo.para: All speedometers and tachometers are programmed electronically at the factory via the cluster data link. All dip switches are set to "0". Factory programming for both speedometer and tachometer will be deactivated if any dip switch is moved to the "1" position. Factory programming will be reactivated if all dip switches are returned to "0".

Dip switches will have to be manually set if tire size or axle ratio is changed, or if a replacement cluster is installed. The dip switch settings that were electronically programmed are shown on the linesetting ticket, and on a label attached to the cluster (1000-4000 and 8000 only).

When manually programming 1000-4000 and 8000 models, dip switch "7" on the right (tachometer) bank must always be set to "0". Failure to set switch "7" to "0" will result in erroneous tachometer readings. Switch "8" on the right (tachometer) bank controls the odometer and must be set to "0" for miles and "1" for kilometers.

When manually programming on 5000 and 9000 models, dip switch "9" on the right (tachometer) bank must always be set to "0". Switch "10" on the right (tachometer) bank controls the odometer and must be set to "0" for miles and "1" for kilometers. Note that dip switches "9" and "10" now function differently as compared to the earlier stand-alone tachometer unit.

The correct service manual section to use for the 5000 and 9000 models is CTS-5048. For the 1000-4000 and 8000 models, use service manual section CTS-5088. Both of these sections are located in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual. Do not use prior service manual sections for these new instrument clusters.

A cartridge is being developed for the Pro-Link service tool so that instrument clusters can be electronically programmed in the field. It is planned that the future generation of clusters will not have dip switches.
